content: the profile is in appdata\roaming. easiest way to get there is to click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder'. That drops you right in the profile. You need to create the chrome folder - chrome, not Chrome. And in that folder, create text file of userChrome.css
creator: davidsk

content:

creator: Acleacius

content:
- click settings>general and scrollodown to config editor - search for toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets and change to true - then you need a folder named 'chrome' in profile, and a userChrome.css file in the folder (with content shown below). - exit and restart TB and it should work, although I've sometimes found I have to restart TB twice to see changes in userChrome.css - Below is content for userChrome.css 

/*  #######    */ @namespace html url("http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml");  #toolbar-menubar {   order: 1;              }  unified-toolbar {   order: 2;              }  #tabs-toolbar {   order: 3;               }

Note: There were technical reasons for this, resulting in cleaner, simpler, code, so it was no accident. This fix does the job, though.

content:
VAAPI (Video Acceleration API) is an open-source library and API specification, which provides access to graphics hardware acceleration capabilities for video processing.

Maybe you have 'hardware acceleration' switched on and it needs to be switched off.

  • Settings > General
  • scroll to the bottom
  • Uncheck: 'Use hardware acceleration when available'
  • Restart Thunderbird.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Found this. The second option did the trick....

One possible solution to this issue is to try resetting the calendar cache in Thunderbird. To do this, follow these steps: In Thunderbird, go to the menu and select "Options". In the Options window, select "Advanced" and then "General". Click on the "Config Editor" button. In the Config Editor, search for the preference "calendar.network.multirealm". Double-click on the preference to change its value to "false". Close the Config Editor and restart Thunderbird. If resetting the calendar cache does not solve the issue, you can try removing and re-adding the CalDAV calendar in Thunderbird. To do this, follow these steps: In Thunderbird, go to the menu and select "Calendar". Right-click on the CalDAV calendar that is causing the issue and select "Delete Calendar". Confirm that you want to delete the calendar. Go to the menu and select "Calendar" again. Select "New Calendar". Select "On the Network" and then "CalDAV". Enter the URL of the CalDAV calendar and your login credentials. Follow the prompts to complete the setup.

content:
It seems you do not have your smtp settings set up correctly and you are editing via the wrong method when smtp is incorrectly set up.

Account Settings Bottom of left pane below 'Local Folders' - click on 'Outgoing Server SMTP' List of outgoing servers is listed on the right. You should have one for each mail account/email address. Start at the top and work down the list as follows.

  • select name of smtp server and it's details will display below.
  • Click on 'Edit'
  • Description: Type the username/email address which should use this smtp.
  • It must be the same as the 'User name'.
  • Check all other settings are correct for that server which uses that User name.
  • Click on 'OK'
  • Select the second smtp server in list.
  • Click on 'Edit'
  • Then repeat the same process.
  • Description : type in the username/email address. Please note the User name' will be for a different email address than the previous one you edited.

Work down through all outgoing smtp in list. Then check each one - there must be one for each mail account/email address.

Now you need to make sure each mail account is using the correct smtp server.

  • In left pane, select the first account name.
  • Look bottom right for 'Outgoing Server SMTP'

This is where the 'DEscription you entered helps. The displayed info should say the email address for that selected mail account. If it does not say same email address:

  • Click on the drop down arrow and select the one that has same email address as the selected account.

DO NOT click on 'Edit SMTP Server' button. It is a very rare case when you need to use that button. You would only use that button if you know all accounts are using correct smtp server and the server has changed settings.

In left pane select the next mail account name repeat same process.

Do this for all your mail accounts.

Some images below to act as a guide, so you can see which areas I'm talking about. Not the most recent version, but for what is required all is the same. In the example I have used 'Yahoo' Mark' instead of email address for obvious security reasons, but for an example it shows how the Description field can be used to locate the correct smtp for the account.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Correction. Message should have read:

Thunderbird will NOT allow me to send emails from each of my email accounts. Each email has its own SMTP server login to send mail. If I setup the SMTP server for my main account, all other email accounts are automatically assigned the same SMTP Info as the main account. Of course they will not send, and server rejects the login using the info for the main account SMTP login. If I set up the SMTP Server info for one of the other accounts, Thunderbird automatically changes the SMTP Servier login information in the main account setting to match the SMTP login info of the secondary email account, and therefore, the main email account SMTP login is now rejected by the server since the SMTP server login info is not correct for the main email SMTP server login.

I need each email account to go back to using its own SMTP server login info so all of the email accounts can send mail.

By the way, receiving email is not an issue, since all accounts can and do contiue to receive email as they always have.

I can send from all of my email accounts on my Apple devices, iMac, MacBook Pro, iPad Pro, and iPhone 13 normally. This only occurs with Thunderbird.

I just upgraded to the latest Thunderbird, 115.2.2. That is not the issue, since the issue began with the previous Thunderbird version, 102.

How can I fix this?

Thank you.

Randy

content:
I've got two version currently running. 102.15.1 and beta 118.0b4

I can inform everyone that I do get a blank space between bottom of list and Message Pane header. But it relies on three things. 1. The 'Message List' aka Thread Pane contains a small number of emails. 2. The Message List does not have a scroll bar enabled on the right side. 3. The 'Message Pane' is lowered to below the end of list to expose the blank area.

If there are too many emails in list then Message Pane cannot be lowered to a point that exposes the end of list.

content: V "Lokálne priečinky" si vytvorte nový priečinok s názvom napr: OPRAVA. Kliknite na tem priečinok pravým tlačidlom myši, vyberte "Vlastnosti" a upravte umiestnenie smerujúce na ten zálohovaný INBOX o veľkosti 9,4GB napr. C://***/***/INBOX Mali by ste sa dostať k emailom o veľkosti 9,4GB. A už vám neostáva nič iné iba ich rýchlo zachraňovať najlepšie ARCHÍVOVAŤ - označím napr. 2000 emailov a stlačím klávesu "a" a takto postupovať až dovtedy kým tam nezostane žiaden email a všetky staré emaily budú premiestnené do priečinku ARCHÍV. Najlepšie triedenie archívu je podľa letopočtu - teda aby ste v jednotlivých rokoch neprekročili limit 4GB. Veľa úspechov!
creator: Ansamb

content:
Děkuji za odpovědi. Bohužel jsem podobně jako Rzitka (https://support.mozilla.org/cs/questions/1207119) klikl na "Opravit složku" ("Opraviť priečinok"), a to se stejným výsledkem jako rzitka - ve složce zůstalo z původních více než 10 000 asi 30 zpráv a ostatní zřejmě nenávratně pryč. Pro jistotu jsem Inbox přejmenoval a nahradil ho prázdným souborem Inbox a s ním nadále pracuji, ale zůstává otázka, zda by se dalo nějak ty zprávy z původního Inbox nějak obnovit, pokud jsou tam interně opatřeny pouze příznakem, že byly smazány (soubor má stále stejnou velikost). Ztráta dat mě mrzí podobně, jako když jsem cca před více než 14 lety opouštěl kvůli faktickému omezení složky na 2 GB Outlook Express (také došlo k nevratné ztrátě dat).

K velikosti složek (omezení 4 GB) jsem si přečetl článek "https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-d&q=thunderbird+limit+4gb" podle doporučení poljos, ale tam se píše o velikosti jedné zprávy (omezení 4 GB). Evidentně v mém případě neplatí omezení složky na 4 GB. Ta moje složka InBox dosáhla velikosti 9,4 GB, takže docela dlouhou dobu se s ní dalo pracovat i nad 4 GB (a to včetně úspěšné komprese pomocí funkce "Údržba složky"), zatímco nedokončení údržby nastalo teprve v nedávných týdnech.

content:
well you copy it paste it in beside the inbox file and remove the mbox file extension.

OR

Just use the import export tools addon with does this for you on a point and click basis.

What you need to understand is that an MBOX file is not an individual mail, it is a folder full of mails. You will need to have the file imported into Thunderbird through either method for the program to be able to display the individual emails. The open with of the file system can be used with individual EML files, but not MBOX

content:
There is a version of ImportExportTools NG for TB 115, but it's not necessary to import an mbox file to TB.

Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Show in Finder, close TB, copy the mbox file into the Mail/Local Folders subfolder of the profile, remove the .mbox extension, restart TB, find the folder under Local Folders in the Folder Pane.

Comprando un hard disk più grande? Eliminando i messaggi inutili? Compattando la cartelle di Thunderbird? -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle

Se invece ti riferisci allo spazio online, è una cosa che devi chiedere al tuo fornitore.
creator: @next

content:
Toggle devtools.debugger.remote-enabled to true in Settings/General, Config. editor.

https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1253742
